Show Summary

Edit Summary »

Small town. Big secret.

A car accident leads U.S. Marshal Jack Carter into the top-secret Pacific Northwest town of Eureka. For decades, the United States government has relocated the world's geniuses to Eureka, a town where innovation and chaos have lived hand in hand.

Eureka is produced by NBC Universal Cable Studio and filmed in Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada.

Small town. Big secret.

A car accident leads U.S. Marshal Jack Carter into the top-secret Pacific Northwest town of Eureka. For decades, the United States government has relocated the world's geniuses to Eureka, a town where innovation and chaos have lived hand in hand.

Eureka is produced by NBC Universal Cable Studio and filmed in Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada.less «

    ralfyboy666 Added Mar 28, 2009 All my reviews
  •  
    9.5 Superb

    Man is this show underrated or what???Really well taken and acted show. hide « show »

    Eureka is a really well thought of show where even the most impossible phenomenons are explained so realistically that one would think its actually for real.This is the beauty of the show.The series begins with Jack Carter a U.S Marshall accidentally ends up in a secret town of eureka.There is some trouble there(which as you will realize while watching the show that its all the time)and Jack helps to resolve the issue with a totally different approach.The former Sheriff of Eureka is crippled in an accident,and Jack is offered a promotion from being a Marshall to a Sheriff which he doesn't get initially.He and Joey(his daughter) moves to Eureka and the series revolves around their life in Eureka.Jack falls in love with Dr.Allison Blake(she works for the Department Of Defense).Dr.Nathan Stark the head at GD(Global Dynamics)was married to Allison and Jack and Nathan share a maturely disliking each other kind of relationship.There are loads of other important characters which you will become familiar with once you start watching the show.It has its own beautiful world where one would surely get lost.
    Do you agree?

    9 Superb

    Under rated but brillant.personal fav. hide « show »

    This show has good writing and great acting. I like the premise of this show, a town full of genusis (spelling not my fortay) and a sheriff with street smarts. It is humorous and smart without being in your face about it. Colin Ferguson is a great actor and also very cute. Allison Blake Is nice yet bosslady, Jo Lupo is deadly with any weapon. When is it coming back??!! I want it back now. Oh one more thing. Why the hell did they kill Nathan Stark!?
    Do you agree?

    sarock22 Added Mar 16, 2009 All my reviews
  •  
    9.5 Superb

    Cool series hide « show »

    I like the whole premise behind this show. Its a whole town of unexplained mysteries except that there is an explanation. Everybody inside the town has nothing to hide unless somebody is not from Eureka and does not have the proper clearance. Colin Ferguson does a great job as Jack Carter. Salli Richardson has devastating charisma on the show. She is my favorite as Allison Blake. I like how the town is just one huge experimental and research center. Wish that the eps made up a full season. It takes too long to get to the next season. Hope to see more.
    Do you agree?

    cra2ywolf Added Mar 1, 2009 All my reviews
  •  
    9.7 Superb

    Wonderful show. Excellent acting and writing. Good show for the whole family. Intelligent science fiction based humor. hide « show »

    This is a wonderful show. It mixes real life situations with science fiction oriented humor, like how to be a single parent, while simultaneously trying to stop the world from melting, freezing, blowing up, turning to gold, etc...

    The only problem with this show is that during the 3 years it has been on, the longest season has been 13 episodes. I wish Sci-fi Channel would buy more Eureka episodes so they can fill up their time slots with fewer "made for Sci-fi" movies. Don't get me wrong, I like a good "B" movie every now and then, but Eureka is "A" class entertainment.
    Do you agree?
